item.title: [HBASE-11285] Expand coprocs info in Ref Guide
item.summary: Expand coprocs info in Ref Guide

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12648062/HBASE-11285.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12648062

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 2 new or modified tests.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ <para> HBase coprocessors are modeled after the coprocessors which are part of Google's BigTable<footnote>
+ xlink:href="https://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/coprocessor/package-summary.html">coprocessor</link>
+ xlink:href="https://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/coprocessor/RegionObserver.html">RegionObserver</link></term>
+ xlink:href="http://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/coprocessor/WALObserver.html">WALObserver</link></term>
+ xlink:href="https://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/coprocessor/MasterObserver.html">MasterObserver</link></term>
+ <para><filename>hbase-examples/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/coprocessor/example</filename></para>
+ <para><filename>hbase-examples/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/coprocessor/example</filename></para>
+ <para><filename>hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/backup/example</filename></para>
+ <para><filename>hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/backup/example</filename></para>
+ (which reduces its priority, because priorities have the natural sort order of Integers). </para>

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

This message is automatically generated.
I skimmed this. It looks great Misty Stanley-Jones Before I commit, what was the source for this doc? Thanks boss.

This is fantastic. Thanks for putting this together.

There are a couple of issues with the documentation, however:

  1. The list of Observer types should include RegionServerObserver (added in HBASE-7331). While this only exposes a single hook, it should be there for completeness.
  2. The description of endpoints, in particular the sample code referenced, is only correct up to HBase 0.94.x. In HBase 0.96+, the way that endpoints are exposed has been changed to use protobuf services. See HBASE-5448 for details. Unfortunately that will mean amending most of the sample code for the PB service based approach and some modification to the descriptions.

stack Mostly from https://blogs.apache.org/hbase/entry/coprocessor_introduction. I did give credit – see line 22 of the patch.

Gary Helmling Are you able to help out with amending the sample code or can you recommend someone to help out with this?
Misty Stanley-Jones I will take a shot at it, but I won't be able to get to it until tomorrow.

Renamed the existing endpoint section to indicate it is prior to 0.96.x, added a new section for 0.96.x, removed the existing examples and pointed folks to the examples in the Javadoc and the source. Let me know what you think.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12651351/HBASE-11285-1.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12651351

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 2 new or modified tests.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 1 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ <para> HBase coprocessors are modeled after the coprocessors which are part of Google's BigTable<footnote>
+ xlink:href="https://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/coprocessor/package-summary.html">coprocessor</link>
+ xlink:href="https://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/coprocessor/RegionObserver.html">RegionObserver</link></term>
+ xlink:href="https://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/coprocessor/RegionServerObserver.html">RegionServerObserver</link></term>
+ xlink:href="http://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/coprocessor/WALObserver.html">WALObserver</link></term>
+ xlink:href="https://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/coprocessor/MasterObserver.html">MasterObserver</link></term>
+ <listitem><para>Define the coprocessor service and related messages in a <filename>.proto</filename> file</para></listitem>
+ <listitem><para>Run the <command>protoc</command> command to generate the code.</para></listitem>
+ xlink:href="https://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/HTable.html#coprocessorService(byte[])">org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.CoprocessorService</link>
+ xlink:href="https://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/RegionCoprocessorHost.html">RegionCoprocessorHost</link>

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

This message is automatically generated.
Maybe the mighty Gary Helmling will come by and review this latest?
Any chance of a review +1 Gary Helmling?

Misty Stanley-Jones Thanks, this is a huge improvement to our docs.

I just see one small typo in the line:

+ <para>Coprocessors which are loaded in this way oprocessors will be active on all regions of

If okay with you, we can just remove the "oprocessors" on commit.

With that caveat, +1 on the HBASE-11285-1.patch.

Committed to master.

stack Have you been applying doc patches to previous branches as well?

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #5243 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/5243/)
HBASE-11285 Expand coprocessor info in ref guide (Misty Stanley-Jones) (garyh: rev bf827a0331fe3294a11b5f0257093110503c3efc)

Gary Helmling No sir. Just master.
